title: Luggage Storage & Logistics: Travel Hands-Free
intro: Don't let heavy bags drag you down. Taiwan has an incredibly convenient network of coin lockers, manned baggage rooms, and luggage delivery services. Whether you need to store a suitcase for a few hours at a station or ship your bicycle across the island, this guide covers everything a traveler needs to know.

sections.heading: 1. Station Lockers (The Most Common Option)
sections.content:
You will find automatic lockers at almost every HSR station, major TRA train station, and key MRT stations.

ğŸ“ Where to find them?

  • Taipei Main Station: B1 level is a maze of lockers. Look near the HSR/TRA gate entrances and the hallways connecting to MRT.
  • HSR Stations: Usually located near the exits or convenience stores (7-11/FamilyMart) inside the station.
  • MRT Stations: Major tourist stops (e.g., Ximen, Taipei 101, Tamsui, Kaohsiung Formosa Boulevard) usually have them near the information counter.

ğŸ’° Price & Sizes (approx.)

  • Small (fits backpack): NT$30-40 / 3 hours.
  • Medium (carry-on): NT$50-60 / 3 hours.
  • Large (28"+ suitcase): NT$70-80 / 3 hours.
  • Note: Most lockers charge by '3-hour blocks'. If you exceed the time, you pay the difference when retrieving.

ğŸ“ How to use (Foreigner Friendly)

  1. Select Language: Touch screens usually support English, Japanese, and Korean.
  2. Deposit: Place bag inside, close door firmly.
  3. Payment: EasyCard/iPASS is the best method (tap and go). Some older machines only accept NT$50 coins (cashier can change money).
  4. Receipt: Take the printout! It has the Code to open the door (if you paid by cash). If you paid by card, just tap the same card to open.

sections.heading: 5. Common Questions from Travelers
sections.content:
Q: Can I leave luggage in lockers overnight?
A: Yes, usually up to 3 days (72 hours). However, you cannot access them when the station is closed (midnight to 6 AM). If you leave it >24 hours, the screen will ask for the extra payment before opening.
Q: What if I lose my QR code/PIN?
A: Don't panic. Find the station information counter or call the support number on the locker. You will need to prove ownership (describe contents) and pay a penalty fee (approx. NT$200) + storage fee. Tip: Always take a photo of your receipt!
